intro: Villadia squamulosa, commonly known as the squamulose villadia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves that give it a delicate appearance. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodland areas. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
